thread.title: PHOTOS: Costa Rica Fire Department celebrates its 150th anniversary
thread.title_full: PHOTOS: Costa Rica Fire Department celebrates its 150th anniversary -The Tico Times

author: Alberto Font
title: PHOTOS: Costa Rica Fire Department celebrates its 150th anniversary
text:
The Costa Rican Fire Department celebrated on Sunday its 150th anniversary with an event at the Plaza de la Cultura in downtown San José.
Activities included a concert with the Costa Rican firefighters band, a performance by the New York City Fire Department Pipes and Drums, dance choreography from a group of firefighters and a giant cake to share with visitors.
The first two fire trucks used in Costa Rica also were on display.
“Being a firefighter is a passion,”said 10-year veteran Byron Morales from the Estación Central de Bomberos. “It’s something I always wanted to do.”
Ana Elena Warren, a volunteer firefighter from the Tibas Fire Station, said, “I come from a family of firefighters: Both my dad and my brother are firefighters, and I decided to become one, too.”
Young firefighters from several fire stations participate in the celebration of the 150th anniversary of the Costa Rican Fire Department at the Plaza de la Cultura in San José, on Sunday, July 26.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Greivin León from the Barrio México Fire Station poses in front of the 1910 Knox, the first fire truck to arrive in Costa Rica in 1913.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
A group of veteran firefighters share a moment during the celebration of the 150th anniversary of the Costa Rican Fire Department on July 26.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
Fire units from several stations in the country attend the anniversary celebration.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times
The New York Fire Department Pipes and Drums band plays at the 150th anniversary of the Costa Rican Fire Department at the Plaza de La Cultura in San José, on Sunday, July 26.
Alberto Font/The Tico Times

Byron Morales from the Estación Central de Bomberos has been a firefighter for 10 years.
